The purpose of this project is to provide funding to develop a network to enable NGOs to make collective decisions on the basis of need alone and to respond early and fast to ‘under the radar’ emergencies.
The aim of this funding is to improve access to Primary Health Care services and Emergency and Obstetric and Newborn Care services in targeted areas of South Sudan.

The aims of this project are to reduce morbidity among women of child bearing age  to reduce morbidity of children due to Diarrhoea  Pneumonia and malaria and to reduce morbidity of children due to the vaccine of preventable diseases.

The overall goal of this response is to implement and promote sustainable drought response interventions that address immediate acute needs through provision of life saving interventions to 540 000 affected populations as well as start to build longer term community resilience in targeted drought prone areas

The System Enhancement for Health Action in Transition (SEHAT) project aims to contribute to the reduction of avoidable morbidity and mortality with specific emphasis on Maternal  Newborn and Child Health (MNCH) services  by improving the health and nutritional status by reaching the most vulnerable  women  children and under-served areas through sustaining and strengthening of the provision of the Basic Package of Health Services (BPHS) and training of relevant staff.
The aim of this project is to effectively address the common causes of the influx of children on the street.
The aim of this project is to ensure that children affected by the Ebola outbreak are protected from harm and cared for  and their psychosocial distress is mitigated.
The aim of this project is to provide a multi sector response to communities affected by the draught crisis in Ethiopia.

The aim of this project is to provide an integrated package of emergency relief and recovery to selected communities affected by food and nutrition crisis  encouraging the mainstreaming of nutrition security targets and a renewed effort to give priority to food security in rural development programmes

The aim of this project is to improve the health and nutrition status of children and women  through expanded immunisation programmes  strengthened capacity of health facilities and provision of integrated community case management
